text: Mount Süphan (; Sipan,, , and "Sipan" also "Ciyaye Sipan", which means "White/s, Aryan/s" in Kurdish), is a dormant stratovolcano in eastern Turkey, immediately north of Lake Van. It is the second highest volcano in Turkey. == Other websites == * Mount Süphan - map == Gallery == Category:Volcanoes of Turkey Category:Mountains of Turkey
title: Süphan
